title: I think the "Marksman" class DOES deserve a sub-class split

replies.body:
That's not a bad breakdown.

There is a lot of diversity in the marksman archetype, especially with the archetype being capable of lanning anywhere ATM and the great diversity and build routes marksman itemization provides. 
Makes sense they should have at least 2 sub-classes.

Issue I keep running into when trying to describe them is that marksman don't really clump together in specific play-styles though. You can pick a few on the edges with a lot of unique characteristics, but then there's a wide range of marksman stuck in a middle ground for the class.

Even with his ult, I wouldn't call Draven a sniper. He's known mostly for spinning axe damage than he is for sick LCS420 no scope ults. Otherwise good breakdown and hopefully we get some cool names for the marksmen subclasses.

Draven is a good point, I don't know if he would simply be pure "raw damager" though, maybe hybrid "raw damage" with secondary "sniper". I like the idea of having a sub-class that can impact fights from extreme ranges, Draven fits that to some extent even if it's not his primary identity

oh ur on my friends list :o
hi

lmao hey

I met Diana on the forums too

These are some pretty neat sub classes. However, I would suggest Corki under the sniper subclass, as he is poke oriented with his very long range and low cool down ult and strong bomb (could also classify as play maker due to his Package offering incredibly impactful spikes). 

I think kog could also be classed as a sniper considering the very long range of all his abilities and w auto attacks, as well as being very strong when stationary (like an actual sniper!). 

draven is definitely damage oriented though, certainly not a sniper just because of his ult! 

These are a good start at defining the class as a whole. Riot definitely could have done more in this regard.

Thanks for mentioning that, I forgot about Special Delivery.

I think maybe if sub-classes still get sorted as "primary" and "secondary" as the tags are now, then champs with poke like Corki could also be snipers

My logic was that "Snipers" were the champs with extraordinary (pretty much global) range abilities with a huge gap between their range, and the range of even pokers. But maybe SNiper could be more about both long-range and having to aim difficult shots, to include shorter range stuff like Varus, Corki and Kog'maw

I like your breakdown.
But where exactly do "hyper-kites" fit?  Some ADCs rely on superior mobility to kite their opponents to death rather than raw damage, burst, or play-making.  They can be distinguished from other ADCs that just aren't as mobile.  Blue Ezreal is the kite-you-to-death champion.  It isn't about raw damage, burst, or play-making - just about being more mobile to chase you down or run away while dealing damage.
I think that's a good point and could be it's own sub-class. Ezreal though I would still cross as a hybrid between that and Sniper.
To be honest, I don't like your break down. You put Corki in the same place as Vayne. Same with Ashe and Quinn. Vayne and Ashe are auto based while Corki and Lucian are spell based.

This was quick run-down I did earlier today just to start a discussion, but my logic was still along the same lines as Riot for the "raw-damagers"; you get into a range, and whether it's spells or auto-attacks you deal some fuckin' damage.

Corki though, i totally forgot about Special Delivery, he may be a better fit in "play-makers" now.

**Exceptional Range** and **Utility** were the two things that stood out to me first to separate the sub-classes
